block.cyclic.trash.tooltip: Deletes any item piped into it
item.cyclic.experience_food.tooltip: Use sugar on an Experience Pylon
block.cyclic.dark_glass.tooltip: Immune to light, explosions, and wither blasts
block.cyclic.soundproofing.tooltip: Each block reduces sound volume nearby
button.filter.ignoredamage1.tooltip: Ignore damage and match only on item
button.build.first.tooltip: Use blocks left to right as normal
button.build.random.tooltip: Use a random block each time
button.build.rotate.tooltip: Use blocks one by one in a pattern
button.harvester.mode.tooltip: Area will attempt to harvest the whole area at once at the cost of fuel
button.rotations.up: Number of times to rotate the block (for stairs and such)
button.rotations.down: Number of times to rotate the block (for stairs and such)
command.gethome.bed: Your home bed was missing or obstructed
command.home.overworld: Can only teleport to your home in the overworld
command.searchitem.none: No items found within search radius
command.searchtrade.none: No matching trades found in nearby villagers
enchantment.cyclic.excavate.desc: Harvests the whole vein of connected matching blocks, not including diagonals
enchantment.cyclic.multishot.desc: Fires extra arrows from your bow
enchantment.cyclic.smelting.guide: Smelts whatever you harvest with this tool.  Rarity is $0
enchantment.cyclic.beheading.guide: This gives a chance for getting a mob head or a player head.  Creatures from other mods can be added in the config file, and need a players skin as a head.
enchantment.cyclic.autosmelt.desc: Smelts whatever you harvest with this tool.
enchantment.cyclic.beheading.desc: This gives a chance for getting a mob head or a player head.  Creatures from other mods can be added in the config file, and need a players skin as a head.
enchantment.cyclic.experience_boost.desc: Increases experience drops from killing and mining
enchantment.cyclic.launch.desc: Gives you the power of multi jump (double jump) when enchanted on boots.  One extra jump per level, after that cooldown kicks in, sneak to jump normally.
enchantment.cyclic.lifeleech.desc: Leeches life points from your target on attack, and even more on kill.
enchantment.cyclic.magnet.desc: Makes you magnetic for item stacks and experience on the ground
enchantment.cyclic.quickdraw.desc: This triples the speed that your bow draws up to full power.
enchantment.cyclic.reach.desc: Increases your building and mining reach
enchantment.cyclic.venom.desc: Inflicts the poison status effect on the target
enchantment.cyclic.waterwalking.desc: Walk on water when this is on your boots.  Sneak to sink.
enchantment.cyclic.experience_boost.guid: Increases experience drops for killing and mining by factor of $0 per level.  Rarity is $1
enchantment.cyclic.launch.guide: Gives you the power of multi jump (double jump) when enchanted on boots.  One extra jump per level, after that a cooldown of $0 ticks; sneak to jump normally.  Rarity is $1
enchantment.cyclic.life_leech.guide: Leeches life points from your target on attack, and even more on kill.  Rarity is $0
enchantment.cyclic.magnet.guide: Makes you magnetic for item stacks and experience on the ground with radius of $0.  Rarity is $1
enchantment.cyclic.quickdraw.guide: This triples the speed that your bow draws up to full power.
enchantment.cyclic.reach.guide: Increases your building and mining reach to $0.  Rarity is $1
enchantment.cyclic.venom.guide: Inflicts the poison status effect on the target for $0 ticks per enchantment level.  Rarity is $1
enchantment.cyclic.waterwalking.guide: Walk on liquid as if it is solid
gui.enderbook.title: Ender Book Waypoints
guide.title: Cyclic Guide
item.apple_emerald.guide: Resets all expired trades on a villager - trades that have a red X on them.  Or cures a zombie villager.
item.apple_emerald.tooltip: Unlock blocked villager trades (with red X); or cures zombie villagers
item.book_ender.guide: A magical book that stores your current location as a waypoint.  Teleport to the waypoint at a later at the cost of experience, based on distance (configurable).  Cannot cross dimensions, but it can store locations in any dimension.
item.carbon_paper.guide: Use this to copy data from a sign or noteblock.  Then you can paste it any time later.   Craft it again to erase the data.
item.carbon_paper.tooltip: Use to copy a sign or noteblock
item.charm_air.guide: Use this to walk on air.  Right click in your inventory to turn it off.  Compatible with baubles API.
item.charm_air.tooltip: Walk on air; Sneak to descend.
item.charm_antidote.guide: This will cure poison or wither effects that you get hit with at the cost of durability.  Right click in your inventory to turn it off.  Compatible with baubles API.
item.charm_boat.guide: Increases your rowing speed in a boat.  Right click in your inventory to turn it off.  Compatible with baubles API.
item.charm_fire.guide: Gives fire protection if you are in lava or fire at the cost of durability.  Right click in your inventory to turn it off.  Compatible with baubles API.
item.charm_speed.guide: Gives you a passive speed boost, can be stacked with speed potions.  Right click in your inventory to turn it off.  Compatible with baubles API.
item.charm_speed.tooltip: Speeds up you and your mount
item.cyclic.charm_void.guide: Works in your inventory or in a Baubles slot.  This charm saves you from the void; it detects if you have fallen down below $0 and teleports you way up into the sky instead.
item.charm_void.tooltip: Saves you from falling into the void
item.charm_water.guide: This gives you water breathing effect if it finds you running out of air.  Right click in your inventory to turn it off.  Compatible with baubles API.
item.charm_wing.guide: Protects you from falling long distances.  If this is on when you fall more than six blocks, it gives you a short burst of the Slowfall potion effect, which is just like a parachute.  Right click in your inventory to turn it off.
item.chest_sack.guide: This was created when a chest sack is used on a tile entity, containing all of its data for transport.
item.chest_sack_empty.guide: A simple chest transporter.  Works on any tile entity to pick it up and gently place down with all contents/data intact.
item.chest_sack_empty.tooltip: Transport a container with its contents
item.corrupted_chorus.guide: Eat this to phase through walls for a few seconds.  It teleports you back to the starting point if you would end up in a wall.  Otherwise you stay at the end with a few negative effects.
item.corrupted_chorus.tooltip: Lets you phase through walls for a few seconds
item.crafting_food.guide: Unlock a permanent 3x3 crafting table inside your inventory.  Once unlocked, you can open it with a keybinding or with a button in your inventory.
item.cyclic_wand.shifting: Use the mouse wheel while sneaking to rotate
item.cyclic_wand_build.guide: Advanced long range building tool.  Has a custom HUD to change the direction (sneak and mouse wheel) Fill its inventory with blocks to build with.  Has different building modes: Random, Pattern, and Normal.
item.dropper_minecart.guide: Its inventory is the same as a Dropper.  Use an activator rail to make it drop one of its items.
item.dropper_minecart.tooltip: Drops an item when it hits an activator rail
item.dynamite_mining.guide: This creates a powerful explosion that does not hurt players or mobs.  It does break blocks, but unlike regular explosions no blocks are lost, so it acts like mining.
item.dynamite_mining.tooltip: Drops 100% of blocks broken as items.  Does not hurt anything living.
item.dynamite_safe.guide: This creates a powerful explosion that does not destroy blocks or hurt creatures.
item.dynamite_safe.tooltip: Does not break blocks or hurt players
item.emerald_axe.guide: Similar to Diamond but with better enchantability
item.emerald_boots.guide: Similar to Diamond but with better enchantability
item.emerald_chestplate.guide: Similar to Diamond but with better enchantability
item.emerald_helmet.guide: Similar to Diamond but with better enchantability
item.emerald_hoe.guide: Similar to Diamond but with better enchantability
item.emerald_leggings.guide: Similar to Diamond but with better enchantability
item.emerald_pickaxe.guide: Similar to Diamond but with better enchantability
item.emerald_spade.guide: Similar to Diamond but with better enchantability
item.emerald_sword.guide: Similar to Diamond but with better enchantability
item.emeraldgear.guide: All the emerald gear has the same attack and defense power as diamond, but slightly lower durability.  It has the same enchantability as gold (which is higher than diamond), so you are more likely to get higher quality enchantments when compared to diamond.
item.emeraldgear.title: Emerald Gear
item.ender_eye_orb.tooltip: Reuseable ender eye for finding strongholds
item.ender_eye_orb.guide: Reuseable ender eye for finding strongholds.  The spawned flying eyes will never drop an item.
item.ender_blaze.guide: Charge and launch dark fireballs.  Dark Fire does not destroy blocks or hurt players at all.
item.ender_dungeon.guide: This flies towards the nearest mob spawner (which is usually in a dungeon or mineshaft), similar to how the Ender Eye flies to the stronghold portal.  It flies quite slowly at first, then gradually speeds up, and when it gets close enough it then starts moving more vertically.  However this does have a maximum range, so nothing will happen if you are too far away.  Maximum range is in config, in number of blocks in any direction.
item.ender_fishing.guide: A projectile that catches a (vanilla) fish wherever it lands.
item.ender_lightning.guide: Charge and launch ball lightning that summons lightning wherever it lands.
item.ender_pearl_mounted.guide: A re-useable ender pearl, with a twist.  When this launches an ender pearl, you also get mounted on the ender pearl and fly with it, so you can see where you will land.
item.ender_pearl_mounted.tooltip: Reuseable ender pearl that carries you
item.ender_pearl_reuse.guide: A re-useable ender pearl.  Consumes durability and launches an ender pearl.
item.ender_snow.guide: Better than your regular snowball.  When it lands, it keeps stacking snow layers up.
item.ender_tnt_1.guide: Throw these to make explosions.  There are six different levels of power.  These are standard normal explosions with no special properties.
item.ender_tnt_4.guide: 1/3 power of charged creeper; Same strength as TNT
item.ender_tnt_4.tooltip: 1/3 power of charged creeper; Same strength as TNT
item.ender_tnt_6.guide: Same power as charged creeper; Same strength as Ender Crystal
item.ender_tnt_6.tooltip: Same power as charged creeper; Same strength as Ender Crystal
item.ender_torch.guide: A throwable torch.  This places a torch in the world wherever it lands.
item.ender_torch.tooltip: This creates a torch wherever it lands
item.ender_water.guide: Throw this to create a water source block wherever it lands.
Vaporize nearby liquid, three modes of water, lava, generic liquid
item.ender_wool.guide: Throw a bunch of these at a herd of sheeep to shear them all at a distance.  Gives a slight bonus to wool drops compared to regular shears.
item.cyclic.evoker_fang.guide: Summons a beam of Evoker Fangs in whatever direction youre facing.  Must be used on an entity or a block.
item.cyclic.evoker_fang.tooltip: Summons the secret magic of the Evoker Illager
item.fire_dark.guide: Does not burn players or destroy blocks.
item.food_step.guide: Eating increases your step height to a full block like a horse (eat again to undo)
item.food_step.tooltip: Eating increases your step height to a full block like a horse (eat again to undo)
item.glowing_chorus.guide: A balanced way to get the power of flight.  Gives you a few (stackable) minutes of creative flight each time its eaten.  Use milk to remove.
item.glowing_chorus.tooltip: Gives you a few (stackable) minutes of creative flight each time its eaten.
item.gold_furnace_minecart.guide: The plain Furnace Minecarts in the game are unusable; they lose speed quite fast, especially on corners, so the fuel cannot even overpowere the drag/friction.  This Gold furnace minecart has much less drag while it has fuel, so it wont stop after two corners.
item.glowing_helmet.guide: Enables glowing night vision while worn, you can also turn it on and off by right-clicking (works in most inventory screens)
item.gold_furnace_minecart.tooltip: Does not lose momentum while fueled
item.gold_minecart.guide: This is just a faster version of the regular minecart.
item.gold_minecart.tooltip: Higher max speed, and less drag when carrying
item.heart_food.guide: A permanent health upgrade.  Craftable or found in chests.
item.horse_upgrade_jump.effect: Increase jump height of your horse
item.horse_upgrade_jump.guide: A permanent stackable jump increase for your horse.
item.horse_upgrade_speed.guide: Increase the speed of your horse by feeding it a few of these.
item.horse_upgrade_type.effect: Turns your horse into a Zombie Horse
item.horse_upgrade_type.guide: Use on a horse to replace it with a new Zombie Horse.  It will remember its tamed owner but drop its items.
item.horse_upgrade_variant.guide: Feed this to your horse and it will change color.  Stays within the rules for vanilla Minecraft horse spawning.
item.inventory_food.guide: Eating this will unlock two new keybindings, and a second inventory screen.  Open the inventory either as a normal screen for storage, or as an array of Tool buttons to swap any item out with any slot in one click.
item.magic_net.guide: Capture any living creature (non-player) in this magical ball by throwing it at your target.  Release it by throwing it again.
item.magic_net.tooltip: Throw at a living entity to capture
item.mattock.guide: 3x3 mining that treats dirt and stone type blocks equally.
item.mattock.tooltip: 3x3 mining; equal parts shovel and pickaxe
item.password_remote.guide: Remote redstone lever that you bind to a lever in the world by sneaking.  Works across any distance including dimensions if the chunk is loaded.
item.password_remote.tooltip: Bind this to a lever in the world (shift click) to activate it remotely
item.purple_boots.guide: Stronger than diamond, comes pre-enchanted with Feather Falling and Depth Strider.
item.purple_chestplate.guide: Stronger than diamond, comes pre-enchanted with Protection.
item.purple_helmet.guide: Stronger than diamond, comes pre-enchanted with Aqua Affinity and Respiration.
item.purple_leggings.guide: Stronger than diamond, comes pre-enchanted with Mending.
item.sandstone_axe.guide: Worse than stone but better than wood
item.sandstone_hoe.guide: Worse than stone but better than wood
item.sandstone_pickaxe.guide: Worse than stone but better than wood
item.sandstone_spade.guide: Worse than stone but better than wood
item.sandstonegear.guide: The sandstone tools are slightly below stone quality but better than wood.
item.sandstonegear.title: Sandstone Gear
item.sleeping_mat.guide: Use this to make yourself start sleeping right where you stand.  Potion results can be toggled in config.
item.soulstone.guide: A single use item that saves you from death, similar to totem of undying without the effects.  Does not have to be held or in your hotbar, just your inventory.  When it triggers, you come back with 3 hearts, a few positive potion effects, and 10 minutes of Bad Luck and Weakness II.
item.soulstone.tooltip: Saves you from death while carrying.  Single use only.
item.sprout_seed.guide: Grow a magical plant that gives a random junk or treasure when harvested.
item.sprout_seed.tooltip: Grow to harvest random junk and treasure
item.stone_minecart.guide: Think of this as a single-slot chest.  The Stone Minecart can carry any block.  Just use another block or an empty hand to swap blocks in an out (also works with Automated User).  Powered activator rail will pop the block out as well.
item.stone_minecart.tooltip: Carry one block, unload with activator rail
item.storage_bag.disabled: Hit deposit is disabled, left click to enable
item.storage_bag.guide: A simple bag that can hold anything, a portable chest.  Optionally can auto deposit by hitting containers.  Change the items colour in the GUI.
item.sword_ender.guide: Unbreakable sword with a special right-click ability to launch an ender pearl
item.sword_slowness.tooltip: Blocking shoots a slowness splash potion
item.sword_slowness.guide: Unbreakable sword with a special right-click ability to launch a slowness potion
item.sword_weakness.tooltip: Blocking shoots a weakness splash potion
item.sword_weakness.guide: Unbreakable sword with a special right-click ability to launch a weakness potion
item.cyclic.charm_torch.guide: Whenever this detects darkness at your feet, it places a torch there and drains some durability.  Right click in your inventory to turn it off.
item.cyclic.charm_torch.tooltip: Torches the darkness while in your inventory
item.tool_elevate.guide: Teleporter that works only vertically, and only if it can find an empty space with a surface above.  Works on yourself, or target another entity.
item.tool_elevate.tooltip: Teleport yourself or the target entity up to the nearest surface above
item.tool_harvest_crops.guide: This will harvest & replant an area around where you use it; similar to the Harvester machine except it works all at once.
item.cyclic.scythe_brush.guide: Slice down large areas of tall grass and flowers.
item.tool_harvest_weeds.tooltip: Chop areas of weeds and flowers
item.tool_launcher.guide: Aim and then charge this up like a bow and then release it to get launched into the air.  It has two modes, forward and reverse, that you can toggle with attack (left-click).  Forward means you need to aim up into the air, and you fly the exact direction and angle that you look.  Reverse means you have to aim down at the ground and you get launched backwards.  Using this gives you the "bouncy" potion effect, which makes anything you land on bounce you up like a slime block.
item.tool_launcher.tooltip: Hold and use to launch yourself in the selected direction
item.tool_mount.guide: Mount any entity that is not normally mountable.
item.cyclic.stirrups.tooltip: Mount any entity (without the control of the saddle)
item.tool_mount_inverse.tooltip: Pickup a living entity and mount it on your head.
item.tool_mount_inverse.guide: Pickup a living entity and mount it on your head.
item.tool_prospector.guide: Searches out for ores behind the block you click on.  Works in any direction, and lists out exactly what it finds.  If you hit the top of a block it searches down, if you hit the side it searches behind.  Always in a straight line.  Has a blacklist to ignore certain common blocks.
item.tool_prospector.tooltip: Detects ores in a straight line
item.tool_push.guide: This tool has three modes: Push, Pull, Rotate.  Change mode using attack (Left-Click).  Push and pull work similar to a piston, moving the block as long as there is an air block where it is moving; and it also moves tile entities with their data (full chests/furnaces/etc).  Rotate mode will try to spin the block around on its axis, such as log positioning, or halfslabs and stairs moving to alternate orientations.
item.tool_randomize.guide: This will mixup the blocks in the nearby area, to help you vary the texture of your wall or pathway.  Use the attack (Left-Click) to change size.  It affects a flat area along the face of whatever you hit.  Tile entities are ignored (chests and so on).
item.tool_randomize.tooltip: Randomize selected blocks.  Left click to resize.
item.tool_rotate.guide: Attempts to rotate the targeted block while respecting the same material type.  So it will turn a log to a different angle, but will not turn oak planks into spruce planks.  This can be used to get vanilla only blocks that are otherwise un-obainable blocks, like smooth stone double slabs with the flat side, extra smooth sandstone, and a log with bark on all six sides.
item.tool_rotate.tooltip: Rotates simple blocks/machines if they are able
item.tool_spawn_inspect.guide: Tells you exactly which mobs can spawn on the targeted block.  Natural spawns only, ignores mob spawner blocks.  Useful for making slime, witch, and wither skeleton farms.
item.tool_spawn_inspect.tooltip: Detects mob spawns (including modded, slimes, and Wither skeletons)
item.tool_spawn_inspect.up: Click on the top side of a block
item.tool_spelunker.guide: Searches out for empty space behind the block you click on.  Works in any direction.  If you hit the top of a block it searches down, if you hit the side it searches behind.  Always in a straight line.  Great for finding caves while branch mining.
item.tool_swap.guide: Exchange the blocks selected with ones in your inventory.
item.tool_swap.tooltip: Replaces blocks and air with your inventory contents. Left click to change size
item.tool_swap_match.guide: Exchange the blocks selected with ones in your inventory.  Only replaces blocks that match with the targeted center block.
item.tool_swap_match.tooltip: Replaces blocks that match the target. Left click to change size
item.tool_torch_launcher.guide: Shoots out a flying torch that gets placed when it lands.
item.tool_torch_launcher.tooltip: Spawns in a torch wherever it lands
item.tool_trade.guide: Use near a villager for an advanced trading menu.  Has convenience buttons that perform one trade with each click.  Fully respects all villager trading rules, mechanics, locks, and unlocks.
item.tool_trade.tooltip: Opens an improved trading interface with the closest villager
item.tool_warp_home.guide: Warps you back home at cost of durability.  Your home is your respawn point, the same one set by your bed.  Will not work if no home spawn is set.
item.cyclic.charm_home.tooltip: Teleport to your personal spawn point
item.cyclic.charm_world.guide: Warps you to world spawn at the cost of durability.
item.turret_minecart.guide: This has no inventory.  When it hits a powered activator rail, it shoots out a slowness-tipped arrow in both directions.  These arrows cannot be picked up by survival players.  If it stops moving on a powered activator rail, it will fire repeatedly.
item.turret_minecart.tooltip: Shoots skeleton-arrows when it hits an activator rail
item.wand_hypno.guide: Confuse nearby hostiles so they attack each other
item.wand_hypno.tooltip: Confuse nearby hostiles so they attack each other
item.wand_missile.guide: Spawns homing missiles at nearby hostile targets
item.wand_missile.tooltip: Spawns homing missiles at nearby hostile targets
item.cyclic.spell_ice.guide: Turns nearby water blocks into ice.  Costs durability to use.
item.cyclic.spell_water.guide: Turns nearby flowing water into source water.  Fills lakes and rivers out very quickly.
item.cyclic.spell_water.tooltip: Replace nearby flowing water with source water
spell.builder.info: Build by matching the targeted block exactly out of your inventory
spell.ghost.info: Turn into a ghost (spectator) for a few seconds
spell.inventory.info: Open Wand container inventory (Used for Reach spell)
spell.launch.info: Super jump based on facing direction
spell.pull.info: Pull the targeted block (based on side hit)
spell.replacer.info: Replace the targeted block with one to the right in the hotbar
spell.spawnegg.info: Move animals using a respawn egg
block.auto_crafter.guide: Set the recipe, and this will autocraft as many as it can.  Has slots for input materials and output.
block.beacon_potion.tooltip: Use potions to generate beacon effects
block.beacon_potion.guide: Use potions to generate beacon effects
block.beacon_redstone.guide: Displays a beacon beam when powered with redstone
block.beacon_redstone.tooltip: Displays a beacon beam when powered with redstone
block.block_disenchanter.guide: This will strip off enchantments one by one, with a cost.  Feed in your enchantments in the top and books into the middle.  It will consume one of each ingredient for each enchantment removed, and put each one on a book.  There is no way to pick which enchantment is removed, so if it removes the wrong one you just have to keep removing, and then re-add the ones you want back on the normal way (anvil).  Can be automated with cables/hoppers and controlled with redstone.
block.block_fishing.guide: Place down surrounded by water.  Fishes faster more sides are covered in water, minimum 4 of 6.  Then give it a fishing rod and it fishes for you.  It uses whatever is in the fishing loot table, so it works with regular fish, treasure, junk, and modded items that were added.  The frequency indicates how often it will attempt to fish.  You can increase this number by surrounding it with more still or flowing water, so you can use cables and hoppers to automate fishing even further, but the frequency will be slightly lower.
block.block_anvil.guide: When repairs are complete the item moves to the opposite slot.  Can be automated with cables & hoppers.
block.block_anvil_magma.guide: Add lava into the internal tank.  When repairs are complete the item moves to the opposite slot.  Can be automated with cables & hoppers.
block.block_enchanter.tooltip: Add enchantments using experience fluid and energy
block.block_enchanter.guide: Feed in experience as a fluid, and then add any enchantable item. Can be automated with pipes & hoppers.
block.block_fishing.invalidpos: Requires water on at least four sides.
block.block_fishing.tooltip: Place in water and give it a fishing rod
block.block_forester.guide: Plants saplings on any grass-like block nearby.  Harvests logs from the bottom up.  Uses coal or power.
block.block_fragile.guide: Climb this like a ladder, and sneak to build on the opposite side.  Fragile Scaffolding breaks over time all by itself.  Useful for when you are pillaring up, or scaffolding around a building, but you want it to just be temporary.  Now you dont have to go back and take down some dirt pillar later on.
block.block_fragile.tooltip: Decays over time; Place in mid-air.
block.block_fragile_auto.guide: Climb this like a ladder, and sneak to build on the opposite side.  Responsive scaffolding is really easy to break all at once.  After using this to build your roof or to pillar up, breaking one block will also break everything connected to it.
block.block_fragile_auto.tooltip: Breaks itself all in a line when you break the adjacent one; Place in mid-air.
block.block_fragile_weak.guide: Climb this like a ladder, and sneak to build on the opposite side.  Replaceable scaffolding is just that, you can replace it with a block.
block.block_fragile_weak.tooltip: Use a block on this to replace it; Place in mid-air.
block.block_hydrator.guide: Fill this with water so it can infuse blocks with water.  Designed to help automate concrete, and there are a few other recipes as well.  Input blocks above, and withdraw on other sides.
block.block_hydrator.tooltip: Infuses concrete and other blocks with water
block.block_miner.guide: A simple block breaker.  Breaks anything it faces.
block.block_miner_smart.guide: A configurable block miner.  Give it a tool and set up its height and range.  Can have either a whitelist or blacklist of what it can break.
block.block_miner_smart.tooltip: Block Breaker with size controls, a blacklist, and tool slot
block.block_shears.guide: This is a block with shears attached to all sides.  It will shear anyone that collides with it.  Put it in a sheep pen with hoppers around it to automate your wool collection.
block.block_storeempty.guide: This is not a tank.  It is a fake tank that instead stores the full bucket along with the liquid.  Meant for the low tech player to transport large numbers of buckets.
block.block_storeempty.tooltip: Stores up to 64 buckets of any liquid
block.block_user.guide: Automatically use (right-click) any item.  Will try to use on entities and on the block in front of it or down one.  Defaults to 1x1 area but range can be increased.
block.block_user.tooltip: Autonomous right-click activation using any item
block.block_vacuum.guide: Collects items in front of it.  Only fires once per second.  Optional whitelist.  Can be redstone controlled.  Option to render the active selected area.
block.block_vacuum.tooltip: A Vacuum Chest with an optional whitelist.
block.block_workbench.guide: A crafting table that also keeps its inventory saved.
block.block_workbench.tooltip: A Crafting table that keeps its inventory
enchantment_stack.empty: Empty; use an enchanted book to store
block.block_screen.tooltip: Projects text with control of font size, padding, and colour
block.block_screen.guide: Like a slightly advanced computerized sign
block.screen_target.tooltip: Display properties of a distant block
block.screen_target.guide: Target a block with a GPS marker, and you can display its fluid, energy, or item content
block.apple.tooltip: Plant below a leaf to grow
block.apple.guide: A seedling of an apple that grows below any block registered in the leaf ore dictionary.  Can grow with bonemeal, and requires a certain light level to grow.  Small chance of dropping a golden apple.
block.block_library_ctrl.tooltip: Surround this with Ender Bookshelves to deposit
block.block_library_ctrl.guide: The controller block for Ender Bookshelves.  Surround it with Ender Bookshelves so it can connect and it will distribute enchantments.  Can be automated by piping in enchanted books and pulling out empty books.
block.block_library.tooltip: Four drawers of deep enchantment storage
block.block_library.guide: Use enchanted books on any corner.  Each corner stores many copies of that same enchantment.  Use a book on it to withdraw.  Hold a Redstone Torch in your hand and hit it to toggle display modes.
block.builder_block.guide: Pick a shape and a size, and this will auto build a structure.  Shapes available include are Facing (wall), Square, Circle, Solid, Stairway, Sphere, and others.
block.builder_pattern.flip: Flip Regions (purple is source, white is target)
block.builder_pattern.guide: This advanced building machine can copy almost anything.  Select two nearby regions of the world of equal size and shape, give it materials, and it will copy the build from one area to the other.
block.builder_pattern.tooltip: Copy and paste the selected area using supplied materials
block.clock.guide: This redstone clock lets you control the number of ticks that is on and off.  Ticks that its turned on are called the Duration; ticks off are called the Delay.  Power is the redstone signal strength, so 15 for full power and 1 for lowest.
block.clock.tooltip: Clock with time and power controls
block.end_coal_ore.guide: Coal ore that spawns in the End.
block.end_diamond_ore.guide: Diamond ore that spawns in the End.
block.end_emerald_ore.guide: Emerald ore that spawns in the End.
block.end_gold_ore.guide: Gold ore that spawns in the End, drops nuggets.
block.end_iron_ore.guide: Iron ore that spawns in the End, drops nuggets when harvested.
block.end_lapis_ore.guide: Lapis ore that spawns in the End.
block.end_redstone_ore.guide: Redstone ore that spawns in the End.
block.entity_detector.greaterthan: Output redstone based on this comparison to the limit
block.entity_detector.guide: Sends out a redstone signal based on the nearby entities found.  You can control entity type, range, and numbers to detect.
block.entity_detector.tooltip: Detect entity types and output redstone, configure limit and >,<,=
block.fire_dark.tooltip: Does not harm players or destroy blocks
block.harvester_block.guide: Point this at your field of crops and it will gently harvest everything, replanting seeds as it goes.  The harvested crops just land where they are, so you can use other means to collect them (magnet, fan).  Redstone controlled, and the harvested area can be changed.
block.magnet_anti_block.guide: This repells hostile entities away from it every few ticks.
block.magnet_anti_block.tooltip: Repels mobs every $t$ ticks with range $r$
block.magnet_block.guide: Pulls in any item stacks or experience orbs in the world.
block.magnet_block.tooltip: Pulls items and exp every $t$ ticks.  On by default; can be turned off by giving it redstone power.
block.nether_coal_ore.guide: Coal ore that spawns in the nether.
block.nether_diamond_ore.guide: Diamond ore that spawns in the Nether.
block.nether_emerald_ore.guide: Emerald ore that spawns in the Nether.
block.nether_gold_ore.guide: Gold ore that spawns in the Nether, drops nuggets.
block.nether_iron_ore.guide: Iron ore that spawns in the Nether, drops nuggets when harvested.
block.nether_lapis_ore.guide: Lapis ore that spawns in the Nether.
block.nether_redstone_ore.guide: Redstone ore that spawns in the Nether.
block.password_block.activetype.tooltip: Switch between On/Off and Pulse mode
block.password_block.guide: Use this to trigger a redstone signal or pulse from far away.  It triggers when the password you set is seen in chat, at which point the chat display is cancelled.  You can also claim ownership to prevent the password working for other players.
block.password_block.triggered: Password Block triggered; chat message cancelled:
block.password_block.triggeredmany: Password Blocks triggered; chat message cancelled:
block.password_block.userclaim.tooltip: Only the owner of the block can change the password
block.password_block.usersallowed.toolti: Who can active this block with the password
block.placer_block.guide: Place single blocks in the world.
block.placer_block.tooltip: Places blocks in front on a timer or redstone
block.plate_launch_large.guide: Launch entites up into the air.  Works on both living and non-living entities such as item stacks and experience orbs.
block.plate_launch_med.guide: Launch entites up into the air.  Works on both living and non-living entities such as item stacks and experience orbs.
block.plate_launch_small.guide: Jump pad will launch up any entity.  There are three plates each with different jump strength.
Launch entites up into the air.  Works on both living and non-living entities such as item stacks and experience orbs.
block.plate_launch_extra.guide: Launch entites up into the air.  Works on both living and non-living entities such as item stacks and experience orbs.
block.plate_push.guide: A simple conveyor belt that pushes entities around.  Works on both living and non-living entities such as item stacks and experience orbs.  Rotate with Wrench.
block.plate_push_fast.guide: A simple conveyor belt that pushes entities around.  Works on both living and non-living entities such as item stacks and experience orbs.  Rotate with Wrench.
block.plate_push_slow.guide: A simple conveyor belt that pushes entities around.  Works on both living and non-living entities such as item stacks and experience orbs.  Rotate with Wrench.
block.plate_push_slowest.guide: A simple conveyor belt that pushes entities around.  Works on both living and non-living entities such as item stacks and experience orbs.  Rotate with Wrench.
block.plate_push_slow_corner.guide: Corner Belts appear on placement when it detects that nearby conveyor belts can be connected, similar to rails.
block.plate_push_fast_corner.guide: Corner Belts appear on placement when it detects that nearby conveyor belts can be connected, similar to rails.
block.plate_push_corner.guide: Corner Belts appear on placement when it detects that nearby conveyor belts can be connected, similar to rails.
block.plate_push_slowest_corner.guide: Corner Belts appear on placement when it detects that nearby conveyor belts can be connected, similar to rails.
block.plate_push_med_angle.guide: Angled Belts appear on placement when it detects that conveyor belts above can be connected diagonally, similar to rails.
block.plate_push_slow_angle.guide: Angled Belts appear on placement when it detects that conveyor belts above can be connected diagonally, similar to rails.
block.plate_push_slowest_angle.guide: Angled Belts appear on placement when it detects that conveyor belts above can be connected diagonally, similar to rails.
block.plate_push_fast_angle.guide: Angled Belts appear on placement when it detects that conveyor belts above can be connected diagonally, similar to rails.
block.plate_vector.guide: This is a combination of a jump pad and a conveyor, you can configure its strength and angle in the GUI.  Once configured, it saves data into the item, and you can tap it on any other plate to copy the configration into it.
block.plate_vector.tooltip.button: Yaw is the horizontal aim, Pitch is the vertical aim, and Strength affects the distance
block.spikes_diamond.guide: These spikes damage any entity touching it, as long as they are turned on with redstone.  Diamond spikes kill as if damaged by a player, so this includes so called player-only drops such as spider eyes, as well as EXP landing on the ground.  Damage per tick is in the config file.
block.spikes_diamond.tooltip: Powered by redstone; kills give experience and player-only drops
block.spikes_iron.guide: These spikes damage any entity touching it, as long as they are turned on with redstone.  Damage per tick is in the config file.
block.spikes_iron.tooltip: Powered by redstone; damage on contact
block.sprinkler.guide: This only runs while water is directly below.  It will water nearby crops, increasing their growing speed.  Multiple sprinklers in the same area do stack.  Sneak right-click with an empty hand to disable particles from rendering.
block.sprinkler.tooltip: Place over water and near crops
block.sprout.guide: When this is harvested it randomly drops a block from a custom loot table (listed in config file)
block.uncrafting.blacklist: The config file has blacklisted this from being uncrafted
block.uncrafting.notenoughitems: Not enough items to satisfy recipe
block.uncrafting_block.guide: This will lookup and reverse any vanilla 2x2 or 3x3 recipe.  May not work with specialized modded recipes / machine recipes.
block.wireless_transmitter.tooltip: Transmit wireless redstone to a Receiver; hit this on a receiver to pick up coordinates
block.wireless_transmitter.guide: Transmit wireless redstone to a Receiver; hit this on a receiver to pick up coordinates.  Only sends to one receiver.
block.wireless_receiver.tooltip: Receive wireless redstone signals from a Transmitter
block.wireless_receiver.guide: Receive wireless redstone signals from a Transmitter.  Place this in the world first, then hit the transmitter on it.
world.endore.guide: These ores spawn all over the end, the details can be changed in config.  Iron and gold ores drop nuggets.
world.endore.title: End Ore
world.netherore.guide: These ores spawn all over the nether, the details can be changed in config.  Iron and gold ores drop nuggets.
world.netherore.title: Nether Ore
item.potion.slowfall.guide: Reduces fall speed just like a parachute
item.potion.frostwalker.guide: Frost walk over water with magic cold
item.potion.butter.guide: Randomly drop items whenever you move
item.potion.swim.guide: Increase swim speed well beyond normal
item.potion.magnet.guide: Pull items and exp towards you
item.potion.ender.guide: No damage from ender pearl throws
potion.butter.oops: Butterfingers!  Dropped something when you moved.
splash_potion.effect.swim2: Splash Potion of Swim Speed II
lingering_potion.effect.swim2: Lingering Potion of Swim Speed II
block.fluid_pump.tooltip: Extract liquid into cables or machines
block.fluid_pump.guide: Drains straight out in one direction between any compatible blocks.  Connect this to another tank or Fluid Cable.
block.fluid_placer.guide: Fill this with a bucket or fluid cables.  Places fluid in the world on redstone power.
block.fluid_pipe.tooltip: Use an Extraction cable to transfer liquids
block.fluid_pipe.guide: Each cable segment holds a small amount, and it gets pushed through from previous cable segments, and goes out any direction it can find.  Disable output on any face of a cable by hitting with a redstone torch.  You need an Extraction cable to start the flow.
block.bundled_pipe.guide: Just like the other three cables, you need something to start the flow such as a hopper or a pump.  Then this will cary your items, fluids, and power around the connected network until they find a home.  Disable output on any face of a cable by hitting with a redstone torch.
block.energy_pump.tooltip: Extract power into cables or machines
block.energy_pump.guide: Transfer energy out of machines.  Can be used with cables and machines.  Compatible with all Forge Energy systems such as RF.
block.cyclic.energy_pipe.guide: Each cable segment holds a small amount, and it gets pushed through from previous cable segments, and goes out any direction it can find.  Disable output on any face of a cable by hitting with a redstone torch.  You need an Extraction cable to start the flow.  Compatible with all Forge Energy systems such as RF.
block.item_pump.guide: Pump items out of anything into any inventory or the Item Cable
block.item_pipe.tooltip: Use an Extraction cable to transfer items
block.item_pipe.guide: Each cable segment holds a small amount, and it gets pushed through from previous cable segments, and goes out any direction it can find.  Disable output on any face of a cable by hitting with a redstone torch.  You need an Extraction cable to start the flow
block.item_pipe_sort.tooltip: Sorting machine for use with cables and hoppers
block.item_pipe_sort.guide: Connect to item cables or hoppers to sort anything in any direction.  Each colour has one direction inspired by the Buildcraft diamond cables.
block.item_pipe_sort.filter: Output here only if it matches this filter
block.item_pipe_sort.everything: Output everything here, ignoring this filter
block.item_pipe_sort.nothing: Output nothing here, ignoring this filter
item.cyclic.peat_fuel.tooltip: Smelted peat.  Use in a generator.
item.cyclic.peat_fuel.guide: Burn to create energy in the Peat-fired Generator.  This drops from Peat Deposit when harvested.  It burns for 200 ticks.
item.cyclic.peat_fuel_enriched.tooltip: Create energy in a Peat-fired Generator
item.cyclic.peat_fuel_enriched.guide: Burn to create energy in the Peat-fired Generator.  This drops from Peat Deposit when harvested.  It burns for 200 ticks.
block.cyclic.peat_unbaked.tooltip: Slowly turns into a Peat Deposit when sitting in water
block.cyclic.peat_unbaked.guide: Let sit in water to turn into Solid Peat.  Then harvest the Peat Deposit to obtain Peat Fuel
block.cyclic.peat_baked.tooltip: Wet peat ready to be harvested and smelted
block.cyclic.peat_baked.guide: After the Peat Bog soaks in water, it turns into a Peat Deposit and can be harvested to get Peat Fuel
block.cyclic.peat_generator.guide: Burn peat to create Energy.  Create Peat Fuel using Biomass, Peat Bog, and Carbon Catalyst.
block.peat_farm.tooltip: Places and harvests a Peat Bog
block.peat_farm.guide: Places and harvests a Peat Bog.  Requires energy and water.
block.dropper_exact.tooltip: Drop with no randomness and more control
block.dropper_exact.guide: Control location and speed of drops
block.battery_infinite.guide: Creative mode infinite energy source (for cheating and testing)
block.fire_dark.guide: Does not destroy blocks or harm players.  Spawned by Duskflame Hex
block.target.tooltip: Emits redstone based on where the arrow lands
block.target.guide: Emits redstone based on where the arrow lands.  Only works on the side, not top or bottom.
block.moon_sensor.tooltip: Emits signal based on current moons phase
block.moon_sensor.guide: Emits signal based on current moons phase.  Power ranges along 1,3,5,7,9,11,13,15 and back down again.  Stays powered during the day, and changes every night as the moon shifts phases.
item.robot_spawner.tooltip: [EXPERIMENTAL FEATURE] Spawn a Target Dummy Spawner that measures damage done by a player
item.robot_spawner.guide: Spawn a Target Dummy Spawner that measures damage done by a player.  Can be given armor that will affect damage taken, and drop on death.  Has no movement or attacks.  Can be killed, or removed instantly by using the spawner on it again.
block.fire_starter.tooltip: Use flint to start a fire on signal
block.fire_starter.guide: Use flint to start a fire on redsotne signal.  Can face any direction.  Chance to consume flint.
block.fire_frost.tooltip: Low intermittent damage; slowness and weakness
block.fire_frost.guide: Low intermittent damage; slowness and weakness
block.sound_player.guide: Can play almost any non-record sound on redstone signal.  Be careful playing music tracks over and over, they can will overlap.
item.sign_editor.tooltip: Edit sign text, colour, and font
item.sign_editor.guide: Edit sign text, color, and font.  Save data in the sign is fully vanilla compatible, same NBT tags as command blocks when they set colour.
gui.signs.title: Signpost Customization
block.dice.guide: Randomize on placement.  Interact with it in the world to roll again.  Outputs redstone signal using a Comparator
block.imbuer.tooltip: Imbue your bow with secret powers
block.imbuer.guide: Imbue your bow with secret powers.  Place in an ingredient and a bow, and then apply a redstone signal.  Sneak right-click while it is empty to list valid recipes.
item.slingshot_weapon.guide: Charge like a bow.  Shoot with pebbles in your inventory.  Ammo is any item with ore dict matching 'rock'.
item.netherbrick_pickaxe.guide: Stone mining level with improved stats
item.netherbrick_spade.guide: Stone mining level with improved stats
item.netherbrick_axe.guide: Stone mining level with improved stats
item.netherbrick_hoe.guide: Stone mining level with improved stats
item.card_location.tooltip: Saves the location of a block
item.card_location.guide: Use on a block to save a location and use in a wireless machine.  Use on bedrock to clear item data.
wireless.empty: Bind a location to a GPS Marker
chest_sack.error.pickup: Error detected when attempting pickup - action cancelled (see logs for details)
chest_sack.error.place: Error detected when attempting to place - action cancelled (see logs for details)
block.auto_packager.guide: Package items in bulk such as iron and gold into blocks.  Supports custom recipes added using CraftTweaker.
block.dehydrator.guide: Dehydrate certain items.  Add more recipes using CraftTweaker.  Lava is optional but will increase processing speed.
item.shears_obsidian.guide: Ten times the durability of regular shears.  Can also harvest whole melons and pumpkins.
item.boomerang.tooltip: Stuns enemies and picks up items
item.boomerang.guide: Stuns enemies and picks up items.  Bounces off blocks or returns after a fixed distance.  Attempts to activate any block it hits or passes through such as Levers and Buttons.
block.laser.guide: Use GPS Markers to target lasers and heavily customize their appearance.
block.water_candle.guide: Light with flint and steel.  Greatly increases natural mobs spawns nearby.  Follows normal spawning rules of mobs and biome.  Has a chance of being extinguished on every spawn.  Many propertes in config file.
extended.toolbelt: key to open in tool-belt mode
block.fluid_drain.guide: Drain fluid that is nearby and below, filling it with blocks
block.fluid_drain.tooltip: Drain fluid that is nearby and below, filling it with blocks
block.melter.guide: Melt items into liquid, with JEI support and Crafttweaker zenscript support.
block.melter.tooltip: Place over lava to melt items
block.solidifier.guide: Cool fluid into solid items, with JEI support and Crafttweaker zenscript support.
